snippet: A report on the circumstances surrounding the winning World Cup bids by Russia and Qatar has not been released, and the men at the center of the investigation disagree about whether it should ever be made public.
abstract: Report from investigation of winning World Cup bids by Russia and Qatar for 2018 and 2022 has not been released, and Michael J Garcia and Hans-Joachim Eckert, men at center of investigation, disagree about whether it should ever be made public; Garcia says secrecy would be counterproductive and would not quell constant suspicion of corruption at FIFA, soccer's world governing body; Eckert continues to express concerns about privacy.
lead_paragraph: A report on the circumstances surrounding the winning World Cup bids by Russia and Qatar has not been released, and the men at the center of the investigation disagree about whether it should ever be made public.

headline.main: Secret FIFA Report Stirs Dispute Between Investigators
headline.print_headline: FIFA Report Stirs Dispute Between Investigators
